individual_metadata.synopsis: After saving Nightsong in Act 2, she offers to help the player and join them in Baldur's Gate
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. Run oe SCE_SetupNightsong_FreedFromShar or oe SCE_SetupNightsong_FreedFromColony2. Run oe SCE_SetupDebrief3. Run teleport S_SHA_NightsongOR1. Run oe fulcamp in ReCon

13.speaker: Nightsong
13.text: Come to bask in the glow of the Moonmaiden's sword? Be most welcome.

26.speaker: Nightsong
26.text: Begone, friend; I have a darling to adore.

58.speaker: Nightsong
58.text: There you are. I have awaited your arrival with great anticipation. Come closer.

87.speaker: Nightsong
87.text: Feel my voice rattle your bones as I proclaim our victory.
87.context: NodeContext: Beginning a prayer to Selune

73.speaker: Nightsong
73.text: Moonmaiden, Selûne, hear me: Ketheric Thorm, traitor, Apostle of Myrkul, is dead at last!
73.context:
NodeContext: proclaiming the prayer with gusto (but not screaming)
seh-LOO-nuh; MER-kul

109.speaker: Nightsong
109.text: My mate most high, darling Isobel, is safe and well. Safe and well and returned to my embrace.
109.context: NodeContext: proclaiming the prayer with gusto (but not screaming)

60.speaker: Nightsong
60.text: Blessings upon the slayer of the wicked one!
60.context: NodeContext: proclaiming the prayer with gusto (but not screaming)

96.speaker: Player
96.text: I've done some things I'm not proud of, but I'm proud of this. Proud of us.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I couldn't have done it without you.

91.speaker: Nightsong
91.text: We are a powerful party, indeed. Faerûn itself trembles at our touch!

33.speaker: Nightsong
33.text: My darling Isobel says we will stay allied at your side. I am pleased to hear it.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: There's still a great deal about you I don't know.

63.speaker: Nightsong
63.text: Pray ask, and I will tell.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Would your mother be willing to aid us in the fight against the Dead Three?

97.speaker: Nightsong
97.text: Why, she already has. She has brought her sword to your side. Dame Aylin.
97.context: NodeContext: referring to herself. She's dead serious here.

3.speaker: Nightsong
3.text: So mighty are her wonders, her great wisdom. Together, we will set this fair land free of tyranny and murder.

69.speaker: Nightsong
69.text: Do I not radiate with my mother's brightness, her glory?

118.speaker: Nightsong
118.text: There can be no doubt: I am of her silvered flesh, her celestial womb.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: How did you come to be trapped in the Shadowfell?

47.speaker: Nightsong
47.text: Hmm. Ketheric Thorm. Father of my one and only love. Enslaver of Dame Aylin.

98.speaker: Nightsong
98.text: Ketheric Thorm never did trust me, even when he worshipped the Moonmaiden. He was threatened by my love for Isobel, by her love for me.

42.speaker: Nightsong
42.text: When she died - curse the day, the hour! - we each of us mourned bitterly. But Ketheric's pain could be touched by no aid, no boundary.

32.speaker: Nightsong
32.text: He turned to wretched Shar, the Lady of Loss, for relief. And she whispered into his ear, poisoning his mind.

52.speaker: Nightsong
52.text: He and his loathsome advisor Balthazar lured me into the Shadowfell, claimed they'd found someone in need of my aid. There they trapped me in their infernal cage.

14.speaker: Nightsong
14.text: I was killed, murdered, made dead, over and over and over by Justiciars of every make and kind. I was reborn, for it is my nature. And Ketheric fed upon my immortality all the while.

35.speaker: Nightsong
35.text: But lo! The brute is dead. And we, we live!

9.speaker: Player
9.text: You and Isobel seem to have a lot of history...

88.speaker: Nightsong
88.text: A century of it, by now. I loved her from the moment I beheld her sweet face, her great, wise eyes.

117.speaker: Nightsong
117.text: Her father Ketheric never did trust me. He did not fancy an immortal for his daughter's paramour.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: You and Isobel seemed to have a lot of history...

95.speaker: Nightsong
95.text: A century of it. I have mourned her every day these hundred years. When I saw Ketheric had made her live again - made her his thrall - lo, my gorge did swell.

27.speaker: Nightsong
27.text: Isobel was - is - the love of my eternal life. I adored her from the moment I beheld her sweet face, her great, wise eyes.

67.speaker: Nightsong
67.text: But her father Ketheric distrusted me from the first. He did not fancy an immortal for Isobel's mate. I understood; I respected his concerns; but our love was stronger than a father's reservations.

86.speaker: Nightsong
86.text: When Isobel died - curse the day, the hour! - we were each of us agonised. But Ketheric's pain could be touched by no aid, no boundary.

53.speaker: Nightsong
53.text: Now he is dead. And his twisted facsimile of sweet Isobel, returned to the grave. I'd give anything for one more day with her - the real her.

6.speaker: Nightsong
6.text: Alas. I will live my life for us both.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: You claimed you knew things about me. I want to hear them.

72.speaker: Nightsong
72.text: No doubt you do. But I will come to you, when Mother Selûne deems the moment is right. Patience, girl - it will come soon enough. And you cannot unlearn the truths I have to share.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: You seem to know things about Shadowheart. When will you tell her?

24.speaker: Nightsong
24.text: In due time. Mother Selûne will tell me when the time is right. Painful truths should be handled with some decorum.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: I have reason to believe a mercenary named Aradin might try to capture you.

82.speaker: Nightsong
82.text: A mercenary, you say. Then I must find who has set a price upon my head and take theirs in kind.

10.speaker: Nightsong
10.text: I will sleep with both eyes open this night.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: There is a dangerous wizard called Lorroakan who seeks to lay claim to you.

45.speaker: Nightsong
45.text: I trust your judgement. If you believe this magician's threats are sound, then we must face him.

78.speaker: Nightsong
78.text: I will soar above the city and find his lair with my keen sight. Meet me there when you've had your rest. We will fight together - and this magician will fall.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I have defeated Lorroakan, the wizard who sought to hunt you down.

71.speaker: Nightsong
71.text: Ha! I am not surprised. You have a great talent for tearing down Dame Aylin's enemies. Thank you, my friend. From the bottom of my heart.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: How do you intend to spend your newfound freedom?

75.speaker: Nightsong
75.text: I am free from my bonds, but not my duty. The Dead Three are risen - the Dead Two remain.

80.speaker: Nightsong
80.text: You must face them. I will help.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: You should join my camp permanently. We can fight the powers of evil together.

48.speaker: Nightsong
48.text: Our thoughts are as one, my friend. You must face the Chosen of Bane and Bhaal. I will do my part to see them laid low.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: I have questions for you, Dame Aylin.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: I'd have taken gold over a prayer.

83.speaker: Nightsong
83.text: Gold can buy you baubles; a prayer to the Moonmaiden buys you eternity.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Yes, I am quite the Slayer, aren't I?

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Where's the silver light, the moon-magic?

89.speaker: Nightsong
89.text: Listen to the subtle vibrations of the Moonmaiden thumping within your heart-chambers, friend. She works her magic there.

59.speaker: Nightsong
59.text: Moonmaiden, I ask you to cleanse the wickedness in the heart of the slayer of Ketheric Thorm! Forgive them the sin of sending Dame Aylin into his foul clutches!
59.context: NodeContext: proclaiming the prayer with gusto (but not screaming)

34.speaker: Nightsong
34.text: Yes! My mother proclaims you cleansed, our allegiances aligned once more. By her Word, let it be so.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: I am grateful for your understanding.

19.speaker: Nightsong
19.text: You have recovered your soul in the taking of Ketheric's foul life.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Your mother is wrong. I'd send you to Ketheric again, if given the chance.

99.speaker: Nightsong
99.text: Actions are the words of heroes. Let your deeds speak for themselves.

17.speaker: Nightsong
17.text: Now: let us caper, dance, and engage in every ribald pleasure before a new dawn breaks.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: Stay back, ready to defend yourself.

21.speaker: Nightsong
21.text: Ho! Surely you cannot fear me - you who have fought beside me in the war against damned Ketheric Thorm?

92.speaker: Nightsong
92.text: Ah. Ally mine. We are reunited once more.
92.context: NodeContext: Warm, but drained. She's not feeling like herself.

77.speaker: Nightsong
77.text: I was just reviewing our fight against foul Lorroakan; your moves and mine. The victory was soundly won.
77.context: NodeContext: Warm, but drained. She's not feeling like herself.

90.speaker: Nightsong
90.context: NodeContext: Uncharacteristically, Aylin is seeking input. She's usually so confident about everything, but killing Lorroakan has not had the intended effect on her.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: Indeed I do. Let his demise serve as a warning to anyone else who'd seek you out.

101.speaker: Nightsong
101.text: Let him be the last. If my dear mother has any mercy, she will ensure it.
101.context: NodeContext: Trying to stay her usual self, but her mask is cracking a tiny bit here. Privately, Aylin is dealing with a great deal of anger toward her mother, the goddess Selune, But she's not yet willing to face it. How could her powerful mother let all this happen to her?

51.speaker: Nightsong
51.text: Now - I must inform you of my news.
51.context: NodeContext: Warm, but drained. She's not feeling like herself.

56.speaker: Nightsong
56.text: There is a Selûnite enclave not far from fair Baldur's Gate. The Absolute's armies have left them in sore need of aid. Aid I will provide, in the Moonmaiden's name.
56.context: NodeContext: Warm, but drained. She's not feeling like herself.

103.speaker: Nightsong
103.text: But fear not: When the time comes for you to face the foe of foes, Dame Aylin will stand at your side.
103.context: NodeContext: Rallying her soldierly spirit, but still a little drained.

79.speaker: Nightsong
79.text: Go well, friend. The city will be saved - we will be certain of it.
79.context: NodeContext: Rallying her soldierly spirit, but still a little drained.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: We fought well - though I was a little worried about you afterward, in truth.

54.speaker: Nightsong
54.text: Set your mind at ease, my friend. Dame Aylin is more well now than she has been this past century.
54.context: NodeContext: Good humored. Soft in tone. A little uncertain - it's true she's better now than she has been, but why does she feel so shitty, then? (She's in the beginning of reckoning with the trauma of what happened to her).

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I hope you can rest easy now, Dame Aylin.

40.speaker: Nightsong
40.text: Yes. I wish for the very same.
40.context: NodeContext: Good humored. Soft in tone. A little uncertain - she's not sure why Aylin isn't herself.

115.speaker: Nightsong
115.text: Enjoy the spoils of your victory. Spin memories of our prowess in your mind like silkfloss.
115.context: NodeContext: Good humored. Soft in tone. A little uncertain - she's not sure why Aylin isn't herself.
